CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 25, 1954, pg. 2, reads: "City's Oldest Resident's Birthday - Mrs. Sabra Washington, who is known fondly by her neighbors as 'Mother' Washington, celebrated her birthday Monday. She figures she's about 109.  Friends and neighbors held their annual affair for her at her home on Conemaugh Street where she lives with her nephew, Lee McDuffie.  Among those at her party were...Earsley Kincaid and Lee Dorris of radio Station WILY. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Lee Dorris holding WILY radio station microphone, former slave Sabre "Mother" Washington on her 109th birthday, and Earsley Kincaid holding cake, in Washington home on Conemaugh Street
